statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Dikymbe Martin scored 17 points, Brandon Rosser added 16 and UC Riverside used a pair of second-half runs to beat Cal Poly 67-56 on Saturday night.
article.headline: UC Riverside uses 2nd-half runs to beat Cal Poly 67-56
article.linkText: UC Riverside uses 2nd-half runs to beat Cal Poly 67-56
article.story: SAN LUIS OBISPO, Calif. -- Dikymbe Martin scored 17 points, Brandon Rosser added 16 and UC Riverside used a pair of second-half runs to beat Cal Poly 67-56 on Saturday night. The Highlanders (7-13, 5-4 Big West) scored 10 straight to lead 64-53 on Martin's pair of free throws with 51 seconds left. The Mustangs (7-16, 2-7) had the lead to start the second half, but UC Riverside had a 17-0 run, powered in the middle by a trio of consecutive 3s -- two by Menno Dijkstra and one by Rosser. Dijkstra's 3-point play with 13:33 left capped the run at 44-35. The Mustangs got as close as one at 51-50 and again at 54-53, but the Highlanders pulled away from there. Dijkstra added 11 points and Secean Johnson had nine points and 13 rebounds for UC Riverside. Victor Joseph had 22 points on 9-of-22 shooting for the Mustangs.
